Title: ML Certification Strategy
Problem_Statement: Certification pathway for ML-based airborne systems is undefined. Current DO-178C/DO-254 frameworks assume deterministic development. EASA AI Roadmap provides conceptual guidance but lacks detailed compliance means. Need to establish: (1) certification basis for each ML application DAL, (2) means of compliance matrix, (3) authority engagement plan, (4) novel certification approaches (e.g., operational credit, runtime assurance).
Scope: In: Certification strategy; MoC; authority engagement. Out: Specific model certification (95-10 to 95-70).

Title: Learning Assurance Framework
Problem_Statement: Framework for assuring ML model correctness throughout lifecycle is undefined. Traditional V&V assumes requirements-driven development; ML is data-driven. Need to establish: (1) learning assurance objectives by DAL, (2) development process requirements, (3) model architecture constraints, (4) assurance evidence requirements, (5) relationship to EASA W-shaped process.
Scope: In: Learning assurance objectives; process requirements; evidence requirements. Out: Specific V&V procedures (95-30).

Title: Training Data Governance
Problem_Statement: Requirements for training data quality, provenance, and lifecycle management are undefined. ML model behavior is determined by training data; data issues propagate to model behavior. Need to establish: (1) data quality requirements by DAL, (2) provenance and traceability requirements, (3) data representativeness criteria, (4) bias detection and mitigation, (5) data versioning and CM requirements.
Scope: In: Data quality requirements; provenance; representativeness; CM. Out: Synthetic data (ATA 97); specific dataset creation.

Title: V&V Methodology for ML
Problem_Statement: Verification and validation methodology for ML models is undefined. Traditional coverage metrics (MC/DC, statement coverage) do not apply to learned models. Need to establish: (1) ML-specific V&V objectives, (2) test coverage criteria for neural networks, (3) formal methods applicability, (4) robustness testing requirements, (5) out-of-distribution detection, (6) adversarial testing requirements.
Scope: In: V&V objectives; coverage criteria; robustness testing. Out: Specific test procedures (95-30).

Title: Runtime Monitoring Architecture
Problem_Statement: Architecture for runtime monitoring of ML system behavior is undefined. Unlike traditional software, ML may encounter novel inputs or exhibit drift. Need to establish: (1) runtime monitor requirements, (2) out-of-distribution detection methods, (3) performance degradation detection, (4) fallback/reversionary mode triggers, (5) integration with aircraft monitoring systems.
Scope: In: Monitor architecture; OOD detection; fallback triggers. Out: Specific monitor implementations.

Title: Explainability Requirements
Problem_Statement: Requirements for ML model explainability and interpretability are undefined. Certification and operational acceptance require understanding of model behavior. Need to establish: (1) explainability requirements by DAL and application, (2) interpretability methods for different model types, (3) explanation fidelity requirements, (4) human-consumable explanation formats, (5) certification evidence from explanations.
Scope: In: Explainability requirements; methods; evidence. Out: Specific explanation implementations.

Title: Human-AI Interaction Design
Problem_Statement: Design principles for human-AI interaction in cockpit and maintenance contexts are undefined. Effective human-AI teaming requires appropriate trust calibration and information presentation. Need to establish: (1) human-AI teaming requirements, (2) trust calibration mechanisms, (3) AI transparency requirements, (4) workload and attention management, (5) training requirements for AI-equipped aircraft.
Scope: In: Human-AI teaming requirements; trust; transparency. Out: Specific interface designs (ATA 31).

Title: ML Tool Qualification
Problem_Statement: Tool qualification requirements for ML development environment are undefined. DO-330 tool qualification assumes deterministic tools; ML frameworks and training pipelines present unique challenges. Need to establish: (1) tool qualification strategy for ML frameworks, (2) training pipeline qualification requirements, (3) data processing tool qualification, (4) model export/conversion tool qualification, (5) CI/CD pipeline qualification.
Scope: In: Tool qualification strategy; ML framework qualification. Out: Specific tool qualifications (95-70).
